did.unittitle: Joseph B. Danzansky papers
did.abstract: Collection includes speeches, photographs, biographical sketches, videotapes, fundraising documents, membership lists, symposium materials, correspondence, publications, resolutions, a survey, and reports. The material dates from 1968-89. The collection documents the professional life of Joseph Danzansky, particularly during his time as president of Giant Food Inc., his involvement in D.C. development, both economically and socially

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Joseph B. Danzansky papers, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Danzansky Papers were donated to the Gelman Library Special Collections Department in 1991.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Historical or Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Joseph B. Danzansky (1914-1979) received his bachelor of arts, bachelor of laws and juris doctorate degrees from George Washington University. In 1941, Danzansky opened the law firm of Danzansky & Dickey where he practiced until he was elected president of Giant Food Inc. in 1964. In 1977, he became Chairman of the Board of Giant and upon his resignation, in 1978, became chairman of the Board of the National Bank of Washington. Extremely active in the DC community throughout his life, Danzansky was, president (1971, 1976) of the Metropolitan Washington Board of Trade, member of the George Washington Board of Trustees (1969-72), chairman of: the Pennsylvania Avenue Development Corporation (1979), the Business Resource Center (1973-74), and the Mayor's Economic Development Committee of the D.C. (1963-74), as well as a member of many other organizations. His positive impact on the DC community was immediately evident as numerous organizations and individuals took steps to commemorate his memory. The Danzansky Commemorative Committee was formed and it succeeded in honoring the memory of Danzansky by dedicating an amphitheatre at the GW Law School, funding a symposium on Conflict Resolution at GWU, and placing a commemorative plaque on Pennsylvania Avenue.
Danzansky was born on May 16, 1914 in Washington, DC. He married Ethel E. Gelfand and they had two sons, Stephen I. Danzansky and Richard F. Danzansky. Joseph Danzansky died on November 8, 1979.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The materials in this collection include speeches, photographs, biographical sketches, videotapes, fundraising documents, membership lists, symposium materials, correspondence, publications, resolutions, a survey, and reports. The material dates from 1968-89. The collection documents the professional life of Joseph Danzansky, particularly during his time as president of Giant Food Inc., his involvement in D.C. development, both economically and socially, the impact of his death upon the community, and the various means by which his memory was honored. The collection materials were compiled by the combined efforts of Mrs. Ethel Danzansky, Mr. Stephen I. Danzansky, Mr. Barry F. Scher, Mr. Oral Suer, Mr. M. J. Brodie, and Mr. Paul S. Forbes.

arrangement.head: Collection Organization
arrangement.p: Organized into seven series: Personal information, Professional and volunteer associations, Speeches, statements and testimony, Photographs, Post-humus documentation, Audio-visual materials, and Oversized documents.

did.unittitle: Personal information

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains biographical sketches of Joseph Danzansky as well as miscellaneous memos and awards given and received by him. The material dates from 1971-80.

did.unittitle: Biographical Sketch
Awards-given and received
Memos
Professional and volunteer associations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains reports, blueprints, correspondence, memos, annual reports, and other documents related to Danzansky's professional life. The material dates from 1968-89. The subjects of these records include Giant Food, the company's involvement in the Central City Market crisis and the Blue Laws controversy. The records also document Danzansky's time as Chairman of the National Bank of Washington. Danzansky's volunteer involvement related to D.C. development included organizations such as Metropolitan Business Resource Center, The Metropolitan Washington Board of Trade, The United Way, the Mayor's Economic Development Committee, and the Pennsylvania Avenue Development Corporation.

scopecontent.p: This series is composed of the transcripts of speeches given by Joseph Danzansky between 1968-78.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains photographs. These photographs came from photograph albums and cover Danzansky's activities. The albums date from 1972-76.

Post-humous materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The series contains a memorial service program, correspondence, membership lists, publications, and resolutions. These records are dated 1979-92. These records documents the impact of Danzansky's death upon the D.C. community and the work of the Joseph B. Danzansky Commemoration Committee including the naming of the Joseph B. Danzansky Amphitheater at The George Washington University Law School. There is also some information about the National Bank of Washington scandal dated 1980-81.

Audio-visual materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series is composed of eight U-matic reels, one Betamax, and one VHS. The visual picture on the majority of the materials is distorted to various degrees although the audio on all is clear. Most of the items are not dated, but the Danzansky Memorial Dedication Ceremony took place on October 23, 1991. Other tapes are also remembrances of Danzansky.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains an award, framed poem, bound volume, framed certificate, and plaque. Not all the items are dated, but the ones that are dated are from 1971.
